page.para: Rala wants to fly
Rala loves to look out of her window. She watches the birds flying high in the sky.
Rala wishes she could fly like a bird.
She imagines soaring high above the clouds.
Rala does not have wings like a bird.
But she knows there are other ways she could fly.
Rala could fly in a hot air balloon.
She knows how it flies.
Hot air rises inside the balloon, and lifts it into the sky.
Rala could fly in a helicopter.
She knows how helicopters fly.
Their propellers spin very fast to keep them in the air.
Rala likes aeroplanes best.
She knows how they fly.
They have engines to push them through the air.
Outside, Rala looks up and sees an aeroplane!
“Hello!” she calls, as the plane roars past. She wonders where it’s going.
Then Rala makes a wish.
Her wish is to be a pilot when she grows up.
Rala imagines what it’s like to be a pilot.
She can fly above the clouds. She can wave to the birds as she flies past.
In a plane, Rala can go anywhere!
She thinks about all the places she will visit.
Rala will be in the cockpit at the front of the plane.
She will sit at the controls, and fly the plane.
For now, Rala can only fly paper planes. They don’t go far, and she can’t sit in them. But they are fun!
